item.title: Tree blocking street and disabled entrance, 10th January
item.description:
My sister moved a tree from in front of my door. I use a mobility scooter and this is my main entrance. I am concerned I will not be able to exit my property. My neighbours will be putting their rubbish out. How will they do that without putting me, pedestrians or driver's in jeopardy. I need clear access so I can exit and enter my property. None of the trees are mine. Please can it be cleared, its a safety issue. Its Saturday 10th Jan. There are clear signs on my door asking for clearance and access. They were not there yesterday when i got home at 4pm. They were there this morning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Glengarry Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light often stuck on red from steedman st, 10th January
item.description:
The car detectors seem to be miscalibrated. The four way intersection often goes through multiple full cycles before finally going green for the one-way steedman street entrance, despite a long 10-car pileup. Has happened to me multiple times in the last few months where I’m waiting for more than 5 minutes despite at the front of the queue, watching many cycles go by, before I’m finally let through.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Steedman Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
